meanings.sent1: The enslaved people worked hard on the plantation.
meanings.sent2: The enslaved individuals longed for freedom.
meanings.sent3: The enslaved workers joked about their tough boss.
meanings.sent4: The enslaved prisoners felt trapped in their own minds.
meanings.sent5: The image of the enslaved children picking cotton was heartbreaking.

meanings.sent1: The cruel ruler enslaved many innocent villagers.
meanings.sent2: The conquerors would often enslave the defeated soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The evil sorcerer tried to enslave the entire kingdom with his magic.
meanings.sent4: The addiction slowly enslaved him, taking away his freedom.
meanings.sent5: The powerful warlord sought to enslave all who opposed him.

meanings.definition: To be under the control of someone or something
meanings.sent1: She felt enslaved by her own fears and doubts.
meanings.sent2: The citizens were enslaved by the oppressive regime.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to believe it had enslaved the entire household.
meanings.sent4: His obsession with work enslaved him, leaving no time for anything else.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotic melody enslaved the audience, holding them captive.
